summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan, requesting to file under seal an explanation for why government counsel would be unavailable for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial between September 2021 and February 2022, citing personal medical reasons.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; the letter is addressed to her requesting to file under seal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) referenced in the letter; the trial scheduling is being discussed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the letter, submitting the request to the court under seal due to private medical information affecting trial availability.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is formally communicating with Judge Nathan regarding trial scheduling in the Maxwell case.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Government Request to File Under Seal
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office submits a sealed letter to Judge Nathan explaining government counsel's unavailability for the Maxwell trial from September 2021 to February 2022 due to personal medical reasons.

keyFacts: The government requested to file a letter under seal regarding trial scheduling in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Government counsel would be unavailable for trial between September 2021 and February 2022 due to personal medical reasons.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss and addressed to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
